Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Petra H
Reviews.Content: Rose Garden was the greatest hotel we have ever stayed. I enjoyed a beautiful spacious room with our private hamam in our bathroom. Breakfast is till 10:30 so you can sleep late and get a jammy fresh omelette, fruits, nuts, ham, and cheese and of course Turkish coffee. The hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. The manager of the hotel is always around, so you can talk to him about everything from your requests on accommodation to sightseeing tips. I recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to relax just in the heart of Istanbul 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel, friendly staff, convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: kantoV
Reviews.Content: This little gem offers a great choice for staying at the old town of the city. The staff is very friendly, the breakfast of exceptionally high standards with custom-made omelets and traditional Turkish flavours. Rooms have a good size and very strong oriental touch. Price is reasonable and location convenient for the byzantine heritage sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel at the center of the old town in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Birgit40
Reviews.Content: We traveled for 4 days to Istanbul and stayed at the Rose Garden Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel is small but very nice, excellent service - very polite and helpful hotel director. The rooms were very pleasant and clean. Excellent price ratio and I have already recommended the hotel to friends. Within a couple of minutes you are at the center of the old town, everything is in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Anabella-BuenosAires
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days in this charming hotel. Location is great: right next to the small and absolutely stunning mosque Sokullu Mehmet Pasa (donÂ´t miss it!), and just a few blocks away from the Blue Mosque. ItÂ´s walking distance from the Grand Bazar and everywhere in Sultanahamet but at same time far away from the buzz: beside the muezzin you only hear birds singing. The staff is super nice and honors all that has been said for centuries about turkish hospilitaty. Breakfast is simply superb. Tasty pastries and water available all the time in the lounge room. Free wireless. What can say? We will be back, soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel, in a great location with outstanding staff-book now!!”
Reviews.Author: ZaraLightowler
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in the hotel for a long weekend at the end of March 2012 after finding it on TripAdvisor. We were booking our accomodation last minute and weren't sure what to expect. The hotel is charming. The photos on the website do not do it justice. We stayed in the Rose Garden suites (2 parts to the hotel- garden and the roe garden). The rooms are beautifully decorated and they had provided a fruit basket and wine in the room on arrival. Great parts about the room: Great bed with amazingly soft sillky sheets (slept really well), power shower with a really big shower head, flat screen TV, balcony overlooking the courtyard. The hotel has complimentary afternoon tea everyday which is a lovely added bonus- and if its sunny you can take this in the patio-ed garden. They also have a computer and free wi-fi. Decent breakfasts including an omelette station, and plenty of free bottled water. Location is great too. Greatest asset though without a doubt is the staff. They answered all emails promptly before we arrived, arranged a taxi for us from the airport, helped us plan our itinerary and were always on hand if we needed any sort of assistance. I actually left some possessions beind at a public baths on the last day of the trip and emailed the hotel to ask if there was any chance they could help me to reclaim these. I never thought I would get them back from the baths but the management went out of their way to speak to and visit the baths to make sure I did. You will never get service like this at a large hotel....and to be honest even this is rare! Ayhan in particular is an absolute star within their hotel team- loads to thank him for! Thank you for a great trip- we wish there were more hotels like you elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “'Memorable hotel in a fantastic place'”
Reviews.Author: visp554
Reviews.Content: A friend an I stayed for 5 nights at the Rose Garden Hotel in february 2012. A warm welcome, a fruit bowl and a bottle of wine awaited us. Ideally located within walking distance to the tram line and the historic tourist attractions. The breakfast was great - (eggs prepared the way you like it). The staff were eager to help. Free internet access made contacting home via SKYPE easy. The bedroom itself was luxurious and spacious. Great place would like to return there with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience for sure”
Reviews.Author: thegetawaygurl
Reviews.Content: On my second brief trip to Istanbul I needed to be close to the Blue Mosque and indeed I was. On my previous stay I was ensconced in the luxury and warmth of hotel Neorion which is justifiably rated # 1. At this ( rose garden suites,) I was lucky enough to be upgraded to the "new building" and it was greatly appreciated! The desk staff was efficient,respectful , and kind But- not warm. They did not take the time to sit and plot out walking plans like they did at Neorion. They are different classes of hotels . At rose garden suites there was no Turkish delight waiting in the room or a welcoming cup of tea . It was convenient and clean in the New Wing I cannot speak for the older wing. It must be charming in the internal courtyard during warm weather vs March. I would return to this hotel because it was a decent convenient harbor in this fabulous city but it was not Luxurious it was nice . I am a Loews hotels platinum member and so like that luxurious extra attention. If you are looking for clean convenience this is your place . The value was good The bathroom was lovely with an oversized shower - no body lotion amongst amenities. Breakfast and mezze were a nice touch not opulent but adequate A decent place Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: piglioconiglio
Reviews.Content: We have been in this nice hotel at the end of January, with lot of snow and freezing weather. The hotel was warm, comfortable and the staff kind and helpful. We booked airport transfer to/from hotel, the price was a bit high but essential as we arrived/departed at bad time (late in the night& early morning). We booked also the hammam through the hotel, gaining a honest price and shuttle bus to/from hotel, finally being very happy of the choice. Breakfast very varied and abundant, waiters very dedicated to their job, making the overall stay a fantastic experience. The hotel is very well situated within walking distance to major square and tram-way, making it a perfect place where to start to explore the city. We received also a free upgrade to a beautiful room, large and with a nice furniture. Free wifi is also in the room. I would return there in next trip!

Reviews.Title: “This is amazing”
Reviews.Author: Deeseesee
Reviews.Content: From the warmest greeting at the door to the 'wow' when walking into the ottoman suite, this is a place that won't disappoint. Walking into the hotel is like entering a world so different from the noise and bustle of busy Istanbul. It has a great location and an internal courtyard, superb restaurant, amazing rooms and above all, a fantastic staff. When you have been to as many hotels as I have, and Ive been to a lot in many countries, I have learnt that it is always the staff who really make the big difference - that separate a good hotel from an outstanding hotel. This is an outstanding hotel. I'll recommend it to friends and family without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel great value for money”
Reviews.Author: hardworkingsinglemum
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at this hotel. We were very happy with the standard of accommodation which was much better than expected and was very tasteful and comfortable. Free wi-fi in all rooms. Buffet breakfast was excellent with good coffee. The hotel was situated in a back street approx five mins walk from main sites and was a quiet location. The manager Selcuk was very friendly and helpful and will organise tours for you if you want. He even went so far as to get a cake for my daughter's birthday at very short notice which was a fantastic touch. The other staff were also very friendly. Would definately recommend Rose Garden Suites General comments on Istanbul - amazing place, surprisingly little hassle, and everyone seemed incredibly friendly. Felt much safer than London at night. The guide that Selcuk organised provided lots of fascinating information about the sights so was worth the extra expense. Three nights not nearly enough - I would recommend five if possible. We flew with Turkish airlines and this was miles better than easy jet/monarch etc with great service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel well placed”
Reviews.Author: Janne K
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel well placed near Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi.

Reviews.Title: “A night behind the blue Mosquee”
Reviews.Author: zizzituto
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor and after a few days in Istanbul we decided to stay more one night and we choose Rose Garden Suite...It was been a great decision!!The hotel is 5 minutes by walk from the blue mosquee, excellent position for everything, nice very nice place. The room was fantastic and the staff was great..I suggest to everyone, also for the family, to stay in Rose Garden Suite..It's a peace corner in the big city of Istanbul!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterVoellmy
Reviews.Content: I can really recommend the Rose Garden Suites in Istanbul. We had a great room and the staff was very helpful. The location is also close to the tourist attractions and we were able to walk to all the places. The breakfast - buffet was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient; Generous Amenities”
Reviews.Author: NancyNorton
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We were only here two nights, at the start of our trip before we flew to Cappadocia, and then later in the week when we flew back and the next day embarked on a cruise ship. We stayed in two rooms, the first a large room on the ground floor facing a courtyard and the second on a much higher floor with a nice view of the courtyard and the city. Both times we were impressed with the amenities - big bottle of water, a bottle of wine, teas, and really lovely rose scented soap in the bathroom. The restaurant offered generous, tasty breakfasts. We had dinner there one night when we were quite tired, and it wasn't our best meal in Istanbul. Fine, but not great, and it really isn't much of a walk to many other choices. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Checking in and departure was smooth. The public garden and lounge did encourage lounging and the atmosphere was comfortable and the furnishings had more character than the typical commercial hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, wonderful staff, superb location.”
Reviews.Author: RHOBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days over New Years (Dec 2011-Jan 2012). Also related to the Garden House, sharing common areas and reception, etc. 7 days is a long time, but we loved it. The place is a gem in Sultanamhet, and is easy walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, etc. I also cannot say enough about SelÃ§uk and the rest of the staff. . We asked for a double with extra bed for ourselves and our son, and they gave us a good sized room that was not only well appointed but also served us well all week. The breakfasts were superb, and Ayhan organized a day trip for us to Ephesus - (general info: tours to Ephasus often have long waits for the flights back to Istanbul and ours was no exception) - an excellent value with a knowledgeable guide. The Rose Garden Suites property was renovated in the past year or two, and the entire property (30+ rooms including the Garden House) is all new since 2006. We were on the 3rd floor (no elevator, not a possibility in this building) and had a very noisy family our first night (think kids screaming at the top of their lungs while running in the hallways ), but they quieted down as soon as we brought it up to SelÃ§uk. I was on a cane the entire trip , but did not have any difficulty with the stairs or with the location and the walking around the city from here. On New Year's eve the hotel put on a reception with live music, talented and professional musicians who were also friends of the staff, for the guests, and also had a low cost option to have dinner at the hotel, which was very nice in a city where every restaurant charges an arm and a leg for New Years reservations. Two suggestions for the hotel and for people who stay there. The hallways are all marble and so they reflect the sound quite a bit. Carpeting the stairways would make it much quieter without detracting from the look of the marblework on the floors. Ask for a large bottle of water every night during this time of year - it is very dry, and they do not automatically provide one. We would stay here again the next time we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and beautyful city”
Reviews.Author: Fristyler
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the first week of december in this lovely hotel. The location is perfect as it is close to the must see places. Also, the room, the service and the staff have been great. Thank you selcuk, Aslan and the rest of the team for making our stay unforgettable. We hope to see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a must !”
Reviews.Author: C C
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service ! Rooms are great! The staff is so pleasant ! This hotel understands the art of hospitality ! As always a fabulous stay !

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: bulldogtwo
Reviews.Content: Wife and I left another hotel to come here and we were overall happy that we did. There were a couple things that visitors need to know about the Garden Suites. We stayed on the 3rd floor and at night the other guests would come in and you could hear them pretty clearly as the noise carried up the stairway, no elevator, to the rooms. It also had a tendancy to echo a bit. I was also not impressed with the breakfast buffet. Limited choices, greasy eggs, juices unlike many of the other hotels are store bought versus fresh squeezed. The hotel is wood, wood floors that have character and nice, rooms are well furnished, although another shower where the drain is placed on the high side instead of the low side, but the shower was great aside from that, great pressure and plenty of hot water after a long day of walking sightseeing. The shining star of this palce was Selguk, the reception manager. He was warm sincere, welcoming and always accomodating. He was great! Thank you Selguk for making the stay better than average!

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back”
Reviews.Author: rashmeeroshanlall
Reviews.Content: In an 1897 building in the heart of old Istanbul (Sultanhamet), exists this charming boutique hotel with thoughtfully provided services such as - a toilet brush; bathrobes; an electric kettle and a selection of wonderful teas and coffee; prettily decorated rooms; a great breakfast; free snackeroos throughout the day so long as you buy the tea, coffee, wine or beer; a restaurant that knows how to cook. Great value for money and great service. The downside - just one and may be it was particular to our bathroom - the shower run-off dripped onto the bathroom floor making it essential to fling a used towel on it. But that is not enough to keep us away any time we are in Istanbul next.

Reviews.Title: “Billb”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two separate times during our recent trip to Turkey. We started at the Rose Garden and ended up there after almost two weeks traveling around Turkey. The staff was excellent and very attentive to our needs. The location was also great. While we were located in a "neighborhood" it was a short walk to many of the major attractions we wanted to see and we did not feel like we were in an "tourist" area. The outdoor patio was a great place to relax after a busy day walking around Istanbul. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. I would certainly stay here again and would encourage friends traveling to Istanbul to consider the Rose Garden as their "base" in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for your visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie_2004
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk into the lobby and are warmly welcomed by SelÃ§uk, the hotel manager, you know you have chosen the perfect hotel for your visit to Istanbul. SelÃ§uk and his staff do everything they can to make your stay special. The rooms are beautiful and absolutely spotless. A delicious breakfast is served in a garden restaurant each morning, with omlettes made to order. A great plus: perfect coffee, cookies and fruits are available at no cost 24/7 in the lobby. And you find a gift of a delicious bottle of wine in your room when you first arrive. The hotel is perfectly located, close all the sights, you turn right and walk for about ten minutes to the area around the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, etc., and turn left and walk to the Great Bazaar. Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed hotel, centrally located and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ThaitigerThailand
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff and shown our well appointed room. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choices including eggs cooked to order. The location meant we were able to walk easily to the Bazaars, Blue Mosque etc and restaurants. We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: bsbxuxu
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel in a great location. We stayed in the penthouse, fourth floor. The room is enormous; the bed is very comfortable; there are slippers and bathropes to use, as well as good quality soaps and scrubs. The bathtub is large enough for two and the bathroom is just beautiful with the marbles and wood. Very quiet, except for the praying in the morning all around Sultanahmet. Their hospitality is superb. THey serve water, juice, cookies, figs, nuts during the whole day for the guests. The manager, Ayhan is the best host we already had. Everyday he was worried about the best trip for us to make. \he took us to a great carpet store and suggested good restaurants. He also arranged our Capadocia tour. I certainly recommend!!! It is impossible not to feel at home. The negative point is to go away.

Reviews.Title: “Staff make this place what it is ......”
Reviews.Author: Hasanroshid
Reviews.Content: My first trip to this beautiful City and stayed at Rose Garden Suites (also known as Garden House Hotel). My original booking was with Rose Garden Suites and I booked this place due to its reviews on trip advisor and due to the decor of the room, however once I arrived I was taken to a room in the Garden House, NOT the Rose Garden Suites. I first thought I arrived at the wrong hotel but was informed that Rose Garden Suites is a new extension and is part of the same hotel and they have similar rooms in the Garden House. The room I was provided with looked nothing like the one on the pictures of Rose Garden, however I would add that it was still a very nice room, very spacious and clean, however I was disappointed with the fact that the decor wasnt the same as Rose Garden Suites as it was one of the main reasons why I booked it. Although I informed them that this wasnt what I booked, I wasnt offered a room change which was disappointing. What you hear about the walls in true, the walls are thin and at times it can get noisey, however if you there to explore the city and wont be in the room much then it shouldnt bother you much. The staff are excellant, very friendly and attentive. They are able to arrange tours for you which is excellant, however if you know what you want to see and know your history then you shouldnt bother as it isnt cheap!! The Hotel is in a good position, around about a 10 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and around about 15 mins from tram lines. Overall, its a good hotel, if I had the room I requested then it would have made it better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhyates
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Istanbul for two nights to attend a friend's wedding and found this hotel through google. Reviews on Tripadvisor were all positvie so I booked into here rather than a chain hotel. The greeting and welcome upon arrival was great and the manager took plenty of time to introduce himself and offer any help I needed. I had arrived with a suit that needed altering for the wedding that evening and they found me a local tailor, took me there and, importantly, translated for me and this allowed me to spend the day sightseeing rather than doing this all myself. I didn't have time to take up the offer, but the hotel could arrange guided tours from local operators which is useful. I ate in the restaurant a couple of times and the food was very good, and eating in the lovely open air garden area was a very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours shading from the sun. The rooms (I was in one of the suites) were very comfortable and decorated in a way you wouldn't get in a large chain (in a good way). The location is also superb, being in the midst of Sultanahmet and thus close to all of the major historical sites, and 5 minutes walk to the seafront boulevard and great views over the sea to the other parts of the city. The sounds of the regualr calls to prayer provided a great soundtrack to the stay. I was travelling alone and my trip to Istanbul was too short but I'll definitely stay here again when I return with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - satisfied in every way”
Reviews.Author: Graham W
Reviews.Content: After an terrible experience in another hotel nearby, we moved after one night to this hotel. From the moment we arrived we were welcomed and made to feel at home. The staff and especially the guest relations manager could not have done more for us. The room was spotless and large - the decor a bit 'over the top' but comfortable and very well appointed. The hotel has a lovely feel with a nice breakfast room, an outside terrace for dining and a lovely communal lounge with complimentary drinks and free internet. I would thoroughly recommend shortlisting this hotel for a stay in the old part of the city and within easy walk of the Blue Mosque and many of the other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SAJEDAH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our second honeymoon and I can honestly say it was a fantastic hotel. We were greeted by friendly staff on arrival. Our room was airy, clean, comfortable and of a high quality. Beautifully decorated, stunning drapes and bed linen, all in keeping with the old turkish theme. The jacuzzi bathroom was a bonus, again very clean and spotless. Staff are welcoming and very helpful. Location is great, right in the heart of the old city. We have stayed in many 5* hotels around the world and this hotel is nothing less. Charming with a personal feel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Rose Garden Suites for the second time and I am already looking forward to my next visit! I now have stayed there while on business (with a business colleague) and on holiday (with my family) and on both occasions the staff have been extremely knowledgeable and helpful. As a tourist they advised and helped organise trips within and outside Istanbul, and when on business they looked after my business needs just as thoroughly. A cool drink in the courtyard under the trees after a busy day (and night!) in Istanbul is a perfect way to end the day!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful place ever i slept in:)”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixNy
Reviews.Content: Everything is brand new, clean and very comfortable. you should see that awsome ottoman concept. There is even old style turkish bath in your own room. When you open your eyes in that magnificent rooms, you gonna feel your self like someone who is a resident of the ottoman palace.

Reviews.Title: “lovely small hotel in Old town Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: susan t
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights in this lovely hotel in the old part of Istanbul. Easily walkable to most tourist attactions and easy access to the above gound tram and subway. The staff is wonderful..attentive without being intrusive, the rooms are large and comfortable (the linens are beautiful). The breakfast is bountiful, there is a nice area to "hang out". There is laundy service and an English language newspaper daily. Donn't miss this place.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning rooms, great location, good(ish) food”
Reviews.Author: adamthorne
Reviews.Content: The suites have definitely earned their rank in trio advisor! The hotel is very centrally located for exploring Sultahnamet and Istanbul. The highlight is the quality and decoration of the rooms (Ottoman inspired ?) so lots of dark wood and gold about. The rooms are large, include a sitting area and new bathrooms (shower over bath). The service is very friendly and they go out of their way to be helpful, providing maps, guidance etc. The are many hotels in the vicinity so if you are arriving with a taxi from the airport it is advisable to have the address and a map handy. Visiting Beyoglu is a must but a bit if a mission from here, the nearby tram is probably the best way. The included breakfast is Turkish so as long as you are not expecting a fry up or continental you will be satisfied (think fruit, olives etc) and of course some good Turkish coffee. We also ate in the restaurant and enjoyed it but at the same price point Istanbul has better to offer. The hotel is not wheelchair friendly so if that is a requirement stay somewhere else.. Or if you just don't like stairs. So lovely rooms in a good location and good service at good prices for Istanbul. It is not a get away a resort but if you want yo stay in luxury whilst exploring Istanbul, or for business(free, decent wifi) then highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: EUnsal
Reviews.Content: I recommened this place to everybody who wants to have a quaity time in Istanbul. The hotel has a lot to offer. The location is perfect for major touristic places: Sultanahmet, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque. All within 10-15 min walk. The hotel is rather new, 2 months I believe, so everything is new, clean and the rooms are tastefully decorated. There is wireless internet connection everywhere in the hotel. The restaurant serves traditional turkish dishes and the food is delicious. I recommend the chefÂ´s special chicken kebab. There is a nice garden where you can relax and enjoy the refreshments, fresh fruits and some turkish delicasies all day long (and free of charge too!). The owner Aziz Bey and the organizational manager Selcuk Bey are always present to make sure their guests feel at home. I recommend this place absolutely to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Refuge In A Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Arteegee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 weeks in Istanbul in May of this year, one week of which we spent at the Rose Garden Suites with our family. We originally chose the Rose Garden having met the manager (Ahan) while walking the area earlier in our trip. We were looking for a hotel that would suit our family of 6 in 3 rooms. Happily, we were able to confirm arrangements which resulted in a truly great stay in a well run property. The rooms were newly renovated and the overall quality was superb. Tasteful furnishings, comfortable beds and great bathrooms. The hotel is in a vibrant residential community which is adjacent to many of the major visitor attractions. The staff were all helpful and took great pride in ensuring that all aspects of our stay were as enjoyable as possible. This included airport transfers, luggage assistance, great local knowledge and help in arranging excusions around the city. Food and service in the resaurant was excellent. A fun and memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for money one can get for a hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: PensionCARTREF
Reviews.Content: We have spent a long weekend (2-5 September 2011) in this hotel in Istanbul and have nothing to complain about which happens very rarely. Everything they wrote into their offer was exactly as they promised. Room was clean, quiet, comfortable. TV and air conditioning. A nice graden with roses and a pleasant family/club atmosphere. it is a hotel which is friendly, warm and with its personality. Very well locatad near the historical monuments and the Marmara Sea promenade. A very good breakfast and a very good restaurant with tasty meals. Reasonable prices. Honest and helfpul staff. Free airport transfer (we bought a weekend package) and free /complimentary fruit, cakes, tea, coffee in the garden restaurant, every afternoon. Also complimentary water, coffee and tea in the room. But what really makes a difference from many other hotels we stayed in was the excellent customer care shown by the hotel's staff. Polite, honest, helpful and proactive making you to feel very welcomed in that place and Istanbul. We would anytime come back with great pleasure to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A clean and quiet hotel in the heart of Istanbul's Old town”
Reviews.Author: Nile_Geordies
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for a city break to celebrate our wedding anniversary just a few weeks ago. The hotel arranged free transfer from the airport (1am!) and upgraded our room to a suite with a bottle of fizz, a good start to the week! The hotel and grounds were exceptionally clean and tidy; the hotel room was comfortable with the usual mod cons. We received a complimentary breakfast every day though tea, coffee and biscuits were freely available 24x7. There was free Internet access which was handy and the staff were very helpful. We ate their once or twice and the restaurant food was good in the evening. The area around is the old town, it is really close to the Blue Mosque and most of the main attractions and the trams / buses if you want to travel further. Istanbul is more cosmopolitan than I expected even during Ramadan. It was a great site to see all the family's enjoying breaking their fast together in the Hippodrome with stalls selling all kinds. Just the kind of break for something a little different, plenty of history and culture from Egyptian, Roman, Byzantine, Greek & Ottoman influence. We would certainly stay at the Rose Garden Suites again as our chosen base.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: pouldige
Reviews.Content: This is where you want to stay if you are looking for great atmosphere and ditto service. Around 10 minutes walk from the tram and very close to The Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar this hotel is centrally located in the old city. The staff is very kind and service minded, and you really feel that they are there for you!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel with a Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mkillman
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Rose Garden Suites in Istanbul. The room was unique and beautiful. This is a very charming boutique hotel situated in the old city within five to ten minutes walking distance from all of the major tourist attractions. In-house dining was excellent and the hotel offers a very generous breakfast buffet, as well as all-day free soft drinks, coffee, teas and juice. However, what makes this hotel truly special is its staff. An extremely helpful and friendly staff is attentive to your every need. We were very impressed with a young lady named Ozga who befriended us immediately and ensured we had a very informed and pleasant stay. She is an extremely professional, courteous and friendly person who always had a warm smile. If she is not a general manager, she should be.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: edwisla1980
Reviews.Content: One of thew best located hotel with a perfect garden in the center of old city.

Reviews.Title: “If and when we go back, we will definitely stay here”
Reviews.Author: poochCapeTown
Reviews.Content: This B&B/ hotel is very well situated - it is in the heart of the old city and only a 5 minute, and pleasant walk to the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome. It is very close to the other major tourist sites too. It has recently been renovated very nicely. Our room was exceptionally clean, tastefully decorated with some Turkish flair, cool, airy and spacious. The same can be said about the bathroom. Definitely a luxurious feel to the room and bathroom - as good as any 5 star hotel I would say. The room also felt private - the walls and doors were thick enough not to hear the folk next door.The complimentaries are unusually generous - the hotel offers complimentary tea, coffee, delicious shortbread biscuits, water and juice, which is much appreciated after a long, hot day of walking! In addition, the complimentary toiletries are lovely. The breakfast is also exceptionally good, offering a wide variety of foods so that you can choose a traditional English kind of breakfast or a typically Turkish one - with lots of fresh fruit, nuts, yogurt etc. The breakfast terrace, despite not having an expansive view of the sea or city, is pleasant. It is outside in the garden/inner courtyard, but obviously under shade. The hotel staff were very gracious - unfailingly helpful, friendly and professional. My husband and I spent 5 nights there from the 25th July 2011. The only thing that was a slight irritation was the noise of the renovation of a building next door to the hotel. Not something they can do anything about..... and perhaps it is over by now. My husband and I can recommend this hotel without any reservations. Dr Katherine Everett-Murphy and Judge John Murphy, Cape Town, South Africa (PS we did not eat at the hotel restaurant so we cannot rate that)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: shervinb56
Reviews.Content: By staying at Rose Garden House Suites not only you would have enjoyed of perfect services but you would be able to feel the historical roots of istanbul, as this Hotel is situated in historical part of the city very close to Ayasofya and Blue mosques where should be considered as a surprised in Istanbul urban pattern. Hence by figuring out the identity of Istanbul , there would be possible and easy to reach to other parts of Istanbul such as Taksim and Kabatash just by using the tramway and metro. i have to add that the personnel of Rose Garden House Istanbul professionally knows how to make a safe and hospitable atmosphere for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!good place!”
Reviews.Author: oanna2
Reviews.Content: Really nice and quiet hotel comfortable rooms and great breakfast I loved the Garden it's a great place to relax The people are helpfull and provide all the necessary informations to make our trip enjoyable Ayhan ( Host of the property ) great person no one could be more helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice place to stay in...”
Reviews.Author: DanielG05
Reviews.Content: The choice has been made by my girlfriend and I would say that it was a great decision. Location of the rooms is a bit down and you need to walk 23 steps (this is the exact number) and we booked the cozy room on the roof and we really loved it. In the room, there was a large Jacuzzi and a double bed. At first we thought that we might have a problem with the temperature of the room but due to good air condition system in the room, we didnâ€™t have any problem with the temperature. The breakfast was really nice and there were lots of selection. Staffs were very friendly and helpful. We got all the necessary directions from the one of the staff, named called Ayhan. He was really a great expert about the city and sights to see. He had recommended us a place called Sabirtasi in Taksim area which was one of the best homemade Turkish ravioli we had. I would highly recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “A warm ,romantic and friendly place to stay in the heart of historical part of the city.”
Reviews.Author: anjuprakash
Reviews.Content: Rooms had old world charm . Bathrooms were nicely appointed. Very clean and hygenic.Comfortable beds and v.good quality linen.Sumptuous buffet breakfast .Efficient and courteous staff serving us warmly throughout. Special thanks to Hamida and Alhyan for making the whole experience warm and memorable .A very charming experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sam_19821
Reviews.Content: Are very well located in Sultanahmet area and within walking distance to all museums and mosques, There are some steps to get in to the rooms from the entrance but if you are a normal person and can walk 1 -2 miles in a day these 20 steps are not a big issue The room we stayed in called Superior double room which looks to a nice courtyard with roses, it is a luxuary double room and the bathroom is all covered marble which is really nice and clean Overall our stay was really good and the staff was perfect and they helped us to organize some cruises, and booked the best places for dinner I can strongly recommend this hotel if you are looking for an average priced place in the old town. A special thanks to the Manager Ayhan Akkilic He was like our hero with his suggestions and tips

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anna_SaintPetersburg
Reviews.Content: A great luxury hotel for great value of money. A manager Ayhan was very friendly and all the staff was always ready to help. The room was wonderful! New refurbished and well decorated, very cozy and comfortable. Breakfast and dinner were delicious and were serviced at the garden, it was very romantic, we liked it! Good location, just in a walking distance to all the major attractions. We will return there for sure again and again, thank you for all!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: shp73
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel has only recently opened as at the time I was there, the entrance courtyard was being finished and access was via stairs from the adjoining Garden House hotel. I expect it should be finished within a month?? Breakfast and outdoor tables were provided at the Garden House hotel for the reasons stated above. Nevertheless, the Garden House hotel has a nice breakfast/outdoor tables area. Breakfast was nothing to write home about but did have the usual cereal, cold meat, cheese, bread, drinks, fruit. There were also some additional Turkish meze dishes. I would have liked to see a variation in menu though. Didn't have dinner at the hotel but there was a basic but tasty cafe in the street behind the hotel (Ziya Baba - down the road and turn right) for a quick/convenient bite and there are plenty of others though I recommend staying away from the tourist traps. I stayed in an executive room which was quite nice.....done in an Ottoman/Turkish style with standard features for a 3/4 star room. I would note that if you don't like stairs then don't stay here as there are a lot. One set to get down to the entrance and another up to your room. Nevertheless, an average person should manage fine. Staff were quite friendly, helpful with itineraries and polite, though, I thought it was a little inappropraiate for them to sit in the breakfast area eating and drinking while guests were there. The location is good with a 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. Possibly a bit expensive at 160 euros a night. 100 euros might be more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but some improvements to be made”
Reviews.Author: Holmehouse
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay to see the main sites and staff could not have been more helpful. Some building work going on which made access to rooms more difficult and no lift which was not made clear on web site. Not ideal for older people. Very good rooms and bathrooms with nice touches provided - fruit, water and a bottle of wine. Breakfasts were poor - turkish pastries did not live up to their reputation! All arrangements very good and efficient - would definitely recommend but not for older people.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful oasis in old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: garyklina
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days in this lovely place, just a short walk from sultanahmet square, Topkapi palace, blue mosque, hagia Sophia. The staff were utterly friendly and helpful. Business manager Ayhan most efficient and took real care in making recommendations and in solving practical problems. Breakfast in garden terrific. Room decor perfect Turkish de luxe. Only warning is perhaps stay in original building if you have dodgy knees as there quite a few steps to get to suites.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Namusa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife.Hotel is located in the heart of city.Staff were so polite.Breakfast was delicious.I will definetely come back there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,cosy,and warmful Hotel:)))”
Reviews.Author: Niaps
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my a few friends.Everthing was wonderful there.We were picked up from airport as promised.Hotel has a nice garden surrounded with red roses and different flowers.All staff were polite and ready to hep us whenever we need.There was a high speed internet connection, and It made us contact to our family easily..I definetely reccomend this hotel to guests who want to spend their full time ejoyable in their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: aydogan46
Reviews.Content: it is the cutest hotel i have ever seen. my room was so confortable and charming..

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality, warmth and great ambience!”
Reviews.Author: TAMemberIndia
Reviews.Content: On my recent trip to Istanbul I stayed at the Rose Garden Suites, opened recently by the management of the Garden House Hotel (where I have stayed earlier). The hotel is located on a relatively quiet side street with rooms overlooking the street as well as an interior patio. The hotel is in the process of being completed, but is very very charming nonetheless. When completed, I am certain that it will be a fantastic stop for travellers to Istanbul. The rooms in the hotel are very spacious, well appointed and the beds are really comfortable (comfortable hotel beds tend to be a rarity!). The bathrooms are very well done. The Rose Garden Suites at present share staff, dining facilities and the patio with the Garden House Hotel - so it was good to reconnect with old friends such as Ayhan and experience the excellent breakfast (not standard B+B fare but to order) and the hang out scene in the "garden". As we were a group of 8 people, on our last night in Istanbul we decided to dine in. the staff arranged everything beautifully for us - a private dining experience for us within the hotel. What makes the Rose Garden Suites very special is the warmth and friendliness of the staff and the very high level of service on offer. I highly recommend this hotel to all!

HotelInfo.Name: Rose Garden Suites Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk ayasofya mahalle sehit mehmet pasa sok no 5, Istanbul 34126, Turkey
